results.title: I See a dark stranger = The Adventuress
results.creator_credit: Individual Pictures, Frank Launder and Sidney Gilliat
results.brief_description: The shadowy world of German espionage in wartime Britain. Bridie Quilty has grown up in the west of Ireland under the influence of her father’s nationalism and becomes an innocent member of a German spy network. When she discovers secret plans for the D-Day landings - and falls in love with an English officer on leave - she faces her moment of truth on the Isle of Man in the climax of this atmospheric thriller. Stars Deborah Kerr, Trevor Howard and Raymond Huntley.

results.title: I own the racecourse
results.creator_credit: Learning Corporation of America, Anna Home and Darrol Blake
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Stories Round the World”.
A heartwarming and humorous story from the novel by Patricia Wrightson. Set in Sydney, a backward child named Andy buys a racecourse for three dollars from a tramp.

results.title: I owe you
results.brief_description: Designed to encourage managers to consider their influence on the development of subordinate managers and supervisors. Highlights the dissatisfaction and frustrations aroused in subordinates when a manager overlooks their natural desire for development in their jobs. Describes the main points of an action plan devised to solve a work problem and improve subordinate skills.

results.title: I never loved you
results.creator_credit: Cassandra Tytler, Monkey Suit Productions, Corinne Preston and Rebecca McPherson
results.brief_description: Broken hearts, longing and regret…..”I Never loved you” does a tango and a twirl around the question of love. It exalts in the high passion and tragedy of love and romance, all the while too aware that love can be finite and fleeting. Tough guys singing tender songs to gals with innocent hearts but eyes that have seen too much; doe-eyed lovers are left with bloodshot eyes, nursing regret and a broken heart; the carousel of love moves on, passion can make you giddy and then throw you off balance. Where did it all go wrong? Cast includes: Alex Ben Mayor, Louise Woodward, Connal Parsley, Charlie Sheldon.

results.title: I need more staff
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Frank Bagnall and Donald Crombie
results.brief_description: A management game which highlights pressures at the middle management level including competing staff claims and personality relationships. The film is intended to assist group analysis and discussion of management problems relating or organisational control and co-ordination, and for use in the training of middle and senior management groups. Cast includes Don Philps, Stanley Walsh, Bruce Myles, Ronald Morse, John Orcsik.

results.title: I name this ship
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Frank Bagnall and Don Murray
results.brief_description: The “Empress of Australia” built at Cockatoo Island Dockyard in Sydney Harbour, is the newest and the largest passenger vessel in the Australian Coastal Shipping Commission. On paper it represented a unique challenge to the Australian ship building industry. Designed to carry passengers and motor vehicles as well as freight between Sydney and Tasmania. Provides luxurious passenger accommodation, services and recreational facilties for the 40 hour trip.

results.title: I Love you to death
results.creator_credit: Chestnut Hill Productions, Tri-Star Pictures, Jeffrey Lurie, Ron Moler and Lawrence Kasdan
results.brief_description: Joey Boca is a philandering pizza shop owner whose wife Rosalie turns a blind eye to his indiscretions until she spies him fondling a woman in the library aisles. Her initial reaction is to contemplate suicide, but her mother advises otherwise - eliminate the rat and be done with it. So Rosalie and her mother set about finding a killer, but their inept choices result in failure and a comedy of errors. Despite repeated attempts using a variety of methods, Joey appears to be invincible. Directed with bland efficiency by Lawrence Kasdan (The Big chill, The Accidental tourist, Grand Canyon, French kiss), this is a black comedy that ponders notions of fidelity and loyalty, albeit in a screwball manner. The original script is peppered with agreeable jokes but strains too hard to convince the audience that despite its dark premise, the filmmakers are only joking. The bright spot here is the ensemble cast in a range of unusual guises: William Hurt as a bummed out hippie, River Phoenix as a love sick would be murderer, Kevin Kline as a two-timing Italian. Based on a true story. Cast also includes Keanu Reeves, Tracey Ullman and Heather Graham.
